items.text: To the chief Musician, A Psalm and Song of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician, A Psalm and Song of David.

items.text: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Sion: and unto thee shall the vow be performed.
items.plainText: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Sion: and unto thee shall the vow be performed.

items.text: O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.
items.plainText: O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.

items.text: Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.
items.plainText: Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.

items.text: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.
items.plainText: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.

items.text: By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation; who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off upon the sea:
items.plainText: By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation; who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off upon the sea:

items.text: Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains; being girded with power:
items.plainText: Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains; being girded with power:

items.text: Which stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.
items.plainText: Which stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.

items.text: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.
items.plainText: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.

items.text: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.
items.plainText: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.

items.text: Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: thou settlest the furrows thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing thereof.
items.plainText: Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: thou settlest the furrows thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing thereof.

items.text: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.
items.plainText: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.

items.text: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.
items.plainText: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.

items.text: The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.
items.plainText: The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.
